dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits a high altitude lake (150 m).  An egg layer, omnivorous and peaceful community fish which prefers the following aquarium conditions:  pH=7.8, H=15, 29°C water temperature, and rocks, vegetation and driftwood cover (Ref. 6398).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Oceania:  known only from Lake Wanam, a roughly circular lake situated on a small plateau 24 km west of Lae, Papua New Guinea.
dataObjects.references: Allen, G.R. 1991 Field guide to the freshwater fishes of New Guinea. Publication, no. 9. 268 p. Christensen Research Institute, Madang, Papua New Guinea. (Ref. 2847)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 6 - 8; Dorsal soft rays (total): 9 - 11;  Analspines: 1; Analsoft rays: 18 - 21

dataObjects.title: File:Glossolepis wanamensis.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: Author: Eileen Kortright (Roan Art)  Subject: Glossolepis wanamensis  Male "wana" (as they are referred to in the bow hobby), which should not be confused with G. multisquamatus. Also commercially referred to as "Emerald rainbowfish". Over 95% of the "Lake Wanam" rainbowfish sold in the hobby are hybrids or mislabeled Glossolepis multisquamatus.  Category:Atheriniformes images

agents.full_name: Original uploader was Roan Art at en.wikipedia
